title: 111_s1603
content: The Act may be cited as the "Veterans Education Tuition Support Act of 2009" or the "VETS Act of 2009." It provides tuition relief for postsecondary students called to military service. The "Veterans Education Tuition Support Act of 2009" or the "VETS Act of 2009" offers tuition relief for postsecondary students called to military service, including refund provisions for withdrawal from institutions of higher education due to service in the uniformed services. If a student withdraws from an institution of higher education due to military service, the institution must refund the tuition and fees paid for the period in which academic credit was not received. If a student withdraws from an institution of higher education due to military service, the institution must refund the tuition and fees paid for the period in which academic credit was not received, except for payments made from scholarships awarded by the institution. The Secretary may waive repayment of funds awarded under this title for students called to military service. The Secretary may waive repayment of funds for students called to military service, including loan forgiveness for withdrawals necessitated by service in the uniformed services. Loan forgiveness is authorized for students who withdraw from an institution of higher education due to service in the uniformed services. The Secretary will carry out a program to address academic credit issues resulting from such withdrawals. The Secretary will carry out a program to assume the obligation to repay outstanding loan principle and interest for students who did not receive academic credit due to withdrawal from an institution of higher education. The program covers repayment of loan principle and interest for students who did not receive academic credit due to withdrawal from higher education institutions. Loan assistance awarded under part B, minus any returned amounts, is included in the coverage. The program covers repayment of loan principle and interest for students who did not receive academic credit due to withdrawal from higher education institutions, including any returned loan assistance. The program covers repayment of loan principle and interest for students who did not receive academic credit due to withdrawal from higher education institutions, including any returned loan assistance. It includes canceling outstanding principle and accrued interest on loan assistance awarded to the student for a specific payment period. The program covers repayment of loan principle and interest for students who did not receive academic credit due to withdrawal from higher education institutions, including any returned loan assistance. It includes canceling outstanding principle and accrued interest on loan assistance awarded to the student for a specific payment period. Loan assistance returned by the institution is subtracted from the total loan amount awarded. The Secretary reimburses institutions for canceled Perkins loans by paying an amount equal to the aggregate of the Federal Perkins loans in the institution for each fiscal year. The Secretary reimburses institutions for canceled Perkins loans by paying an amount equal to the aggregate of the loans in the institution's student loan fund, minus loans made from Federal capital contributions. The Secretary reimburses institutions for canceled Perkins loans by paying the aggregate amount of loans in the institution's student loan fund, excluding loans made from Federal capital contributions. None of the funds appropriated under section 461(b) can be used for these payments. The Secretary reimburses institutions for canceled Perkins loans by paying the amounts qualified under this paragraph within 3 months of filing an application. Loan amounts returned, forgiven, or waived by the Secretary for students who withdrew due to service in the uniformed services will not be included in the student's calculation. Students who withdraw due to service in the uniformed services will not have the loan amounts forgiven or waived included in their calculation for annual or aggregate loan limits. This withdrawal will not affect their eligibility for grants or loans. The amendments made by this Act regarding service in the uniformed services will take effect for periods beginning after the enactment date. The term "period of service in the uniformed services" is defined as the time from 30 days before a student is required to report for service until they return from such service.
